alert.note: Alert for Northern Blaine County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 16 at 7:54PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: .Melting snowpack and increased reservoir releases out of Canada will continue to cause increased creek flows, which may cause minor flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following area, Northern Blaine County, including Battle Creek near Chinook. * WHEN...Through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6 pm Sunday, the stage of Battle Creek near Chinook was at 8.4 feet. It is forecast to approach its flood stage of 10.0 feet by Monday evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
